text: <@U02AN9NRJSJ> has joined the channel

Hi All! When using the Scores API there's no streaming alternative so I'm wondering whether anyone makes asynchronous requests. As far as I know it's not possible to do this using BFLW because the BaseEndpoint uses requests rather than aiohttp. Is that right? Has anyone else solved this problem / come up with a better idea?

text: async/await is fine unless you hit a blocking section since it's all secretly single threaded. Liam is suggesting you use threading.thread to wrap the blocking code and run it in the background.

text: Liam gave you the code for the function that runs in a thread. That thread is plodding along making requests and calling callback() after each one. In the mean time, your main application loop can get on with things

text:
```def steal_inplay_data(trading):
    while True:
        resp = trading.steal_data()
        do_something(resp)
        time.sleep(68)

trading = ..
..

# create/start thread (runs in background)
xxx = threading.Thread(target=steal_inplay_data, args=(trading,)
xxx.start()

# carry on with things```

elements.text:
def steal_inplay_data(trading):
    while True:
        resp = trading.steal_data()
        do_something(resp)
        time.sleep(68)

trading = ..
..

# create/start thread (runs in background)
xxx = threading.Thread(target=steal_inplay_data, args=(trading,)
xxx.start()

# carry on with things

text:
T=0: send first request
T=9: send second request
...
T= 99: send twelfth request
T = 100: receive first response
T = 101: start processing first response
T = 102: finish processing first response
T = 108: send thirteenth request
T = 110: receive second response
etc

text: <@U02AVRL084A> has joined the channel
I've seen a few of you talking about Redis and from what I understand (limited) it is a RAM based database. Is it inherently thread safe?

elements.text: I've seen a few of you talking about Redis and from what I understand (limited) it is a RAM based database. Is it inherently thread safe?

text: It's single threaded so yes

elements.text: It's single threaded so yes

text: DBs are designed to be thread safe - the nature of the way they work means they're not really a DB if race conditions with transactions could occur

elements.text: DBs are designed to be thread safe - the nature of the way they work means they're not really a DB if race conditions with transactions could occur
